full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 67 of 236 971 LC3KMAX2 Alessi - Cross 1 THE WITNESS: Keep forgetting. I'm sorry. 2 BY MR. PAGLIUCA: 3 Q. There was no part of the house that you were denied access to, correct? 4 5 A. There was no part, no. 6 Q. So you could go wherever you wanted, whenever you wanted, in the house, correct? 7 8 A. Yes. 9 Q. And there was a difference between when Mr. Epstein was going to be in the house and when he wasn't there, correct? 10 11 A. Can you repeat the question and also -- 12 Q. Sure. 13 A. Difference? What you mean, difference? 14 Q. When Mr. Epstein was going to be in the residence -- 15 A. Yes. 16 Q. -- he wanted you and your wife there, correct? 17 A. Only us. He didn't want -- no contractors at the house. 18 Q. Right. And so when he was there, you had to be there pretty much 24 hours a day, correct? 19 20 A. Yes. It was slavery. 21 Q. And you needed to be there at 5:00 a.m. and work all day and go to bed whenever you were able to; is that right? 22 23 A. That's correct. 24 Q. When Mr. Epstein wasn't there, you had the apartment on the other side of the bridge that you and your wife would go to, SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018168
